playbook.title: Responding to a Compromised Network Node

tasks: Use monitoring and detection tools to identify the node.
Check network traffic logs and alerts for abnormal behavior.
Revoke access to the compromised node.
Modify infrastructure as code (IaC) configurations to remove access to the network.
Use network tools to isolate the node immediately.
Use scripted shutdowns to safely decommission the node.
Remove the node from the IaC template to prevent further use.
Apply security patches to all nodes to avoid similar compromises.

sections.section_title: Notify and Engage Incident Response Team
tasks: Notify the incident response team and provide them with details of the incident.
Document all actions taken on the compromised node.
Preserve logs and evidence for forensic analysis.
Investigate how the node was compromised and trace the origin of the attack.
Notify relevant stakeholders (such as executives or clients).
Provide updates on the incident status and any remediation steps taken.
Conduct a postmortem analysis to understand the root cause.
Document lessons learned and how similar incidents can be prevented.
Implement additional security controls where necessary.
Ensure team members are trained to handle future incidents effectively.
